newsitem.title: CHINA: China puts Deng Xiaoping on Internet to mark HK.
newsitem.headline: China puts Deng Xiaoping on Internet to mark HK.

text.p: Want to read the works of Deng Xiaoping? Just log on to the Internet where a selection of the speeches of China's late paramount leader are available to celebrate the Hong Kong handover.

To celebrate China's resumption of sovereignty over Hong Kong on July 1 -- and the 76th birthday of the Communist Party of China on the same day -- the party mouthpiece, the People's Daily, has launched Deng's works on its website, the newspaper said on Saturday.
Just log into WWW.PEOPLEDAILY.COM.CN, the newspaper said.

"This will enable most readers who use computers to read 'The Collected Works of Deng Xiaoping' quickly and conveniently," the People's Daily said. Deng died last February, aged 92, after ruling China for more than 18 years.
China's propaganda machine has shifted into top gear this week to eulogise the late paramount leader, whose 1984 deal with Britain ensured the handover of Hong Kong at midnight next Monday.
